Reviews.Title: “Trish Greenock”
Reviews.Author: Trish78_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with friends good value for money good access to public transport

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Osti_87
Reviews.Content: Very clean and tidy! Amazing breakfast! Staff very friendly gave me tonnes of advice what sights to see and how to get there... Will definatley stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Dominique S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights while on a weekend trip to Berlin. While the staff were really friendly and helpful and the breakfast was one of the better one's we've had on this type of budget, the room left much to be desired. The motorway is fairly noisy, even with the doors and windows closed; and the room was too warm with the heaters on and very cold with the heater off. We had a room with a private bathroom, however there was a shared bathroom right outside our room which was really noisy all through the night. Our towels smelt of mildew and one of them was ripped in the corner. The 'Standard Double Room' which we stayed in states that it comes with 1 Double bed, however this was in fact 2 single beds. In their advert on Booking.com they indicate that there is free public parking, however this is only with a sticker; otherwise it costs €5 per day. Most of the tourist attractions are a minimum of 35 minutes away by public transport and it is not possible to get there without at least one transition. Alexanderplatz is about 40 minutes with public transport. This was not a deal breaker for us as the trains and subways run very regularly, but it did get quite tiring towards the end of the trip. Wi-Fi is only free if you take the breakfast. Overall the friendly and efficient staff did not make up for the discomfort of the room and the distance from the city. We wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: scooby_1991
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I can't fault anything, the staff were so friendly and were just lovely. The whole place was very clean and tidy everywhere was spotlessly clean, the rooms were big. It was a very cheap room and we thought it would be basic but it was really great the shower was fab the bathroom was very good, quiet, suitable for everyone. Not one fault, brilliant and close to the tube. I would recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “What to expect”
Reviews.Author: teague58
Reviews.Content: The old saying you get what you pay for applies here. The place is spotless and functional. Do not believe that it is centrally located or at least convenient to anything. Even the underground is a good walking distance, at least ten minutes. There is absolutely nothing to speak of within reasonable walking distance, possibly a few restaurants could be found during more than an hour walk and a small shopping strip. Tried it to find an internet cafe recommended by the hotel staff, 40 minutes of walking came up with a den of characters, got my pocket picked besides an attempt to charge me double. So would not recommend it. Unfortunately when asked, the staff said the lobby computer was "impossible" to use, no second thoughts about that. Watch what you sign upon reaching there tired from a long trip and you are asked to sign your credit card receipt, small print by signing you are authorizing them to convert your funds to theirs plus a three and a half percent charge. My debit card company charges nothing for the conversion so I gave them a gift with that mistake. The rooms are basic, don't ask for sheets or blankets again: "impossible", although previously I was told "no problem" ,if you press the issue "you did not pay for it". Basic room clean, bed with mattress and comforter, small sink only in the shared bathroom units. The floor bathrooms cover about 6 or 8 rooms but are spotless and maintained as is the rest of the place, very clean, large and in my case never had to wait for usage, showers great. The only English speaking TV channel reception was weird kept cutting off, on for a few seconds off for a few seconds. When I brought this to the attention to a staff member, wanted to send a technician while I was out of the room (?) When I complained that he could just switch tv with an empty room. First he was too busy then I find him at my door with a tv to swap. A bit later I find that it made absolutely no difference, next morning mentioned to another member of the staff, he said right off it is a problem with the system in the entire hotel, unknown to the first guy? A little strange. I am glad I signed up for only two breakfasts for my seven day stay. A better choice is to have coffee and pastry at the train station or a small shop at the entrance to the U Bahn, full breakfast elsewhere. This hotel seems to be a conglomerate with lots of similar huge cut rate hotels. Summary I will be guided by if I book there again: be alert, don't expect convenience, expect a clean and comfortable accommodation, bring a book to read, go elsewhere for internet computer use and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and comfortable. It is reasonably priced and an excellent location for a city break vacation. There were plenty of places to eat and shop near by. The room was small but clean and quite adequate. The breakfast was fine. The staff was great and all spoke excellent English. Shower not the best as water splashes all over the floor. Rooms could get quite warm unless the aircon is left on full

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BG2010
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in June 2011. The hotel is clean and well maintained. Staff was friendly and helpful upon check in. They gave us a map and showed us how to get to the S bahn to go to the downtown core. This is a basic hotel we had shared facilities which fine no one else seemed to use them while we were there. The room was not air conditioned and in June Berlin was 30 degrees. We had to sleep with the windows open but our room faced the highway so it was noisy most of the night. We didn't eat breakfast here found a little cafe near the train station which was cheap and convenient. The price was good and hotel was ok for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: Loups
Reviews.Content: Location was good we just jumped on the U or S Bahn to get around. Clean and comfortable shared bathroom but it was spotless and clean, beds were super comfy. For the price it was great. We didnt stay much at the hotel as it was just a base to see Berlin from we only slept there and had 1 drink in the small bar 1 night. Overall it was great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: PublioF
Reviews.Content: A bit far from the city center but still a very good place to stay. Very near a subway station. Fantastic breakfast! They charge 5 euros for a parking space which is not worth the price. You can just park on a quiet street behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great!”
Reviews.Author: jjust
Reviews.Content: Didn't enjoy my time here. It was a bad location with nothing around and the rooms were average. The place offered very little in atmosphere. The only good thing was the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: nigelrummery
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel, very clean room and hotel with good breakfast, hot and cold. Staff were pleasent and I have no problems about this hotel to report. Would I use this again, yes. A little walk to U and S Bahn ( Heidelberger str) station but once there Berlin is at your finger tips. We had a pleasent stay here, thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “very basic room, location good for sbahn”
Reviews.Author: mykitten
Reviews.Content: Great cheap deal for this room, otherwise I would be very disappointed. The room smelled stale, decorated in woodchip and looked like a hostel rather than a hotel room. We went for the shared bathroom. These were clean and tidy. Room smelled of smoke throughout our stay and lingered on our clothes! (non smokers here) Hotel has restaurant and bar (we didnt try these). Hotel lies between two s bahn stations and there is a nearby U bahn too. Lidl is about a ten min walk away. Handy to get to the rest of berlin, quiet but I wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: frodonl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights, earlier this week. It's a very decent no frills hotel, with very friendly staff. While the hotel is not exactl in the center of the city, it is located at a relatively short distance (about a 700m walk) from a S-bahn station, making it easy to travel from and to all parts of the city. I went for a room without a bathroom. The shared bathroom and toilets were very clean and I never had to queue for them. The bed was comfortable enough, even for my not exactly small body. The only issue was the pillow - it was rather thin and soft. The staff are perfectly willing to give an extra pillow though, so it's not a big issue. Breakfast was very decent - way better than I have come to expect from hotels of this type! I had a room at the front of the hotel and I did notice quite a bit of traffic noise with the window slightly opened, starting early in the morning. It wasn't a problem for me - I was up early and even if I hadn't been, I don't usually wake up from a bit of sound anyway - but I can imagine it bothering some people.

Reviews.Title: “Good value basic hotel at the price.”
Reviews.Author: Atomic_Elk Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The good: Good price compared to other hotels in Berlin. On the outskirts of Berlin but S Bahn station about 5 minutes away with quick access to the centre of Berlin. Staff pleasant and helpful. Good breakfast selection. Good availability of showers and toilets (our room had shared facilities). Peaceful residential area. The not so good: location is next to main roads and a couple of flyovers at the front so a bit noisy there (we were at the back!).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, very good value for money, but not the most comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jordanekpl
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel were very pleasant and helpful, and it was exceptional value for money for our 4 night stay, although we chose a twin room with a shared bathroom. The bathrooms were adequately clean and functional but the rooms, although not dirty, were not sparkling clean and fresh, nor particularly bright and inviting. However, if you are looking just for somewhere to get your head down in a private room at a low cost, and are prepared to travel a little outside the centre using the S-bahn and U-bahn, this hotel could be just the thing for you.

Reviews.Title: “A lot more than expected - overall brilliant budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatiePM_Bridgend
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a spur of the moment purchase. We got cheap flights with ryan air and then had to book something quick. My partner booked this and i didnt know about it until after. The reviews were that good but were okay. The hotel location is fantastic about a 5 minute walk from a main train station which took you into all main sites. Hotel itself was basic but very clean and overall brillaint. Couldnt have asked for anything more. Bathroom was lovely, massive power shower - always hot. Double bed was very comfy, also had a tv and desk. Wardrobe and even a seperate heater in case you got cold. Only thing to improve would be the sheets on the bed. Staff were very helpful - all spoke engish and willing to help. Lovely little bar. Would definately visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, warm and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: saulejanusonyte
Reviews.Content: Very nice hostel/hotel. I liked everything. Location is good - nearby is metro station, which can bring you every where you want. Quite far from Kudamm or Alexanderplatz, but with metro is not a problem. There are lifts. Bathroom is warm and clean, but water runs badly and need to be repared. I didn't get a room this a bath inside, so I do not know how it is in. Only bad thing is that you must leave the key at reception. Not convinient.

Reviews.Title: “berlin city messe”
Reviews.Author: ikuropka
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in short walking distance from S-bahn station Heidelberger Platz, from which you can easily reach any place in Berlin. I got room in the quiet part of hotel - so, that I could take a good rest during the nights. Personnel is very responsive. Rooms are clean and comfortable. In the shared bathroom every shower is in separate cabin, also very clean. There is a lobby bar where you can got a drink in any time of the day. Unfortunatly internet access is 10 euro! it's horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Pete1007643
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much for the money but were very impressed. Very friedly English-speaking staff, rooms basic but comfortable. Toilets spotlessly clean - we went for the shared bathroom option. Breakfast was included in the package and was huge, with an enormous choice of teas, food, cereals, youghurts. The location is fine - literally 5 minutes walk from the nearest U- and S-bahn station. The neighbourhood is very safe - one of our party went for a walk at 4am and felt fine. The corridors are quite echoey, so can be a bit noisy when people come back from clubs at 5am! There is an excellent bar just the other side of the S-Bahn station, called Heidelbier - very warm welcome and nice and snug. So all in all, an excellent base for budget exploring of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel for tourists looking for a base.”
Reviews.Author: chrisbaete
Reviews.Content: Travelling with friends we just needed a room and shower facilities, but what we got was far more. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and warm. The showers were excellent and always warm. And the breakfast was fantastic. The area doesn't have a lot going on but as the train station is close this is ideal for people where cost is an issue. If you are looking for a clean, well maintained and friendly hotel then this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel's reception”
Reviews.Author: NeginS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel for 3 nights. We are not satisfied with the personnel of the reception. Most of them were not friendly and if you asked them for a favor they denied. Although the hotel was clean and the towel and sheets were changed every day, I did not feel relaxed during the staying at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “basic but very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: silke63
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice now at this hotel. Both times I booked the cheapest room available - basic twin room with bathroom in the corridor. The room was basic, as I expected for the rate I paid, but very clean and with very comfortable beds. I had a very restful night both times. The bathroom was also very clean. I only slept there, did not use the restaurant or bar as I was meeting up with a friend for meals, but all members of staff I met were very friendly and helpful. Based on my experience, I woudl highly recommend this hotel for the budget traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless night.”
Reviews.Author: Offensive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during a trip through germany heading for Czech republic. We thought it would be nice to stop and see some of Berlins turist attractions and get some sleep before venturing on the next day. I requested a double room, non smoking, with wifi(listed as free on Totalstay.com) and in a quiet corner of the hotel. First we got a small room with two single beds situated along one wall toe to toe with no room to turn into a double bed facing the noisy highway on the same floor as a group of american highschool students set on partying all night, they did not respect the non smoking rules for our floor so our room was constantly covered in a cigarette haze, I informed the receptionist who assured me that he would take immmediate action but must have forgotten it so we got very little sleep that night. The wifi turned out to cost 6 euro for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: VanderMeer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was easy to find, however a little out of the way. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. The first room we got was small with a sink and no bathroom. We asked for an upgrade and paid 15 euros. This room was much better. We were on the top floor with a balcony and a full bathroom. The hotel is nothing special, but we were pleased with our room. If you have a car it might be better so you dont have to walk as far to the public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Give Sebastian Walluscheck medal for offensiveness”
Reviews.Author: zlotana
Reviews.Content: Pls be informed, that my apartment (booking.com) it was one room with twin bed and sofa plus small kitchen. no hair dryier, no terasse, no place for eating, no towels for 4 person's, no cleaning rooms without asking for it and no friendly service. I was there for 5 nights (23-28.06.2010) with my grand mom and two sons (13 and 4 years old) - our "apartment" was per two buildings from enter with stairs up and down.. when I asked for bigger and nearer room ...hotel's receptionist Sebastian Wallusheck informed me, that: 1) "It's my choice: to stay today here or not" (100% non-refundable prepayment..) 2) "He told me last time, that he doesn't want to do something for me because.. 3) because he doesn't care about my problems..." 4) that is better room in hotel.. when I asked for contact with hotel's manager mr. Walluscheck give me advice to make phone to manager from different Winter's Offenbacher Hof hotel.. We were after half of day in airports and waiting for check-in (14.00) (hotel didn't give us possibility to check in earlier as I asked (with senior and children..)) - I just take keys and go with peace.. there were more receptionists - all of them were laughing and speaking local lanquage at the same time. I visited many countries and hotels but such conditions I think are offensive and mocking. -- Ana

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy188590
Reviews.Content: When we arrived from the S-bahn, we had a hard time to find the hotel. It is approximately a ten minute walk to the hotel. I felt very unsafe walking back to the hotel by night, because it is very dark and there are hardly any people on the streets. We had a nice room with two single beds, a sink and a television. We had to share the bathroom and toilet, but that was no problem. It is a simple room, but is has everything you need. How much time do you spend in your room anyways? A good hotel for a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable..”
Reviews.Author: i_am_marianto
Reviews.Content: First of all i want to write the first thing i will always remember from this hotel..we stayed there 4 nights and one day we returned from our shopping with my friend and one of the receptionist(a man 50 yeras old i believe), while we were talking he grabbed me like hugging me and he did not let me go.After that we run with my friend in our room and the other day we left I regret that i did not report this event in the hotel or in the police but we got scared.. About the hotel is good, typical rooms, but not comfortable and a bit coldy...too far from the metro station

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - terrible location”
Reviews.Author: traffelindood
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Winters Hotel. After taking the S-bahn to the outskirts of Berlin we had a hard time finding it. It's a good 10 minute walk off the main road. We arrived at about 7pm and the friendly receptionist told us our room was not in the main high rise hotel building but in an apartment complex next to it. Strange. The building was a bit shabby. It seems that Winters hotel own a few apartments in the building. Up we went to the fourth floor in the small elevator and were pleasantly surprised by a small and clean no frills two bedroom apartment (1 bedroom was tiny with just a bed and nightstand). There was a small TV and desk. Being hungry I went to reception and all the restaurant had was pizza. I found a Vietnamese menu in the apt. building and the receptionist and his colleague were kind enough to translate the German menu into English. They called in the order for me which was nice of them. The staff were great and made up for the hike. Breakfast buffet was included in the morning and was really good. Internet was available in the lobby for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “never stay again”
Reviews.Author: trdd12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Berlin last week, and we stayed at this hotel. I book online, and they said was 3 star hotel. Well we found out the hotel not even 1 star. It's AWFUL hotel that I never stayed in my life. smoking smell awful that you can imagine!.......YIKES!!!!..........

Reviews.Title: “Location again not great”
Reviews.Author: ChipPan
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews recently are pretty accurate with this hotel. Location is not great, I guess coming from London this would be the equivalent of staying in Fulham in London as far as geographical location is concerned- i.e. southwest and 35-40 mins to central places. We stayed in one of the nicer rooms, the bathroom looked nice and clean. The lack of a supermarket or shops close by is not great - although you could go to the petrol station or the bakery during normal hours. 10 euros for the hotel breakfast we didn't try because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel far from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: BrazilViajante
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really not expensive for Berlin. The en suite room we got was not big, but big enough, clean and quite confortable. The hotel is located in a residential area along a major freeway (no problems with traffic noise, though). There's no place to eat near the hotel (besides the very limited offer of the hotel itself), and subway and train station is about 400m walking distance. The subway trip to the major attractions take from 20 to 40min. Nothing very disturbing, but you've got to have that in mind when you book the hotel. The only disappointments were that they charged for the open unattended parking spot (we could as well have parket on the street) and when we finally noticed that they haven't discouted the 10% we payed in advance during the reservation, they simply said they could do nothing, since we should have complained before they charged in the credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, location could be better”
Reviews.Author: KarBristol-England
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well priced, we stayed two nights and cost only £57 for the room. However the hotel details said only 8km form Shonefeld airport, but it was actually 18km (32 euros), and the underground was a 5 minute walk but you have to get on and off quite a few times before you arrive at the shopping or tourist areas! The receptionists were very vague with directions and how to use the transport system so we had to work this out for ourselves. We also got the tram (S Bahn) to the airport when we left which was advised by the receptionist, but they failed to say that the airport tram was very infrequent and sometimes doesn't run, and so we waited over an hour for the tram and only knew it was going to the airport because a german passer-by told us! we could have missed our flight! The hotel is modern and comfortable and clean which was just what we wanted, but the location let it down (no eating or drinking places within walking distance). Makesure you research the hotel yourselves before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: 2whistles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently and it was excellent value for the money. It is out of Berlin but the city's transport links make it very easy to get around and the hotel is only about 5 stations from the centre of town on the U/S Bahn. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast is cheap and plenty of variety. Rooms are furnished by Ikea but they are clean and comfortable. Ideal for those who are using a hotel as a base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but not centrally-located”
Reviews.Author: mollymurphy
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and stayed 3 nights in August 2007 while touring Berlin. The bottom line: we probably got what we paid for, as the room was not particularly expensive. By the end, though, we were starting to wonder if we'd overpaid. Our en suite room was sparse and box-like, and appeared to have been furnished largely with decor from IKEA: acceptable, but not fancy or particularly comfortable. We brought our laptop along, but found that there was a considerable extra charge for use of the hotel's internet access. Breakfast, likewise, was not included in the room price, which was disappointing. At around 8 EU per person...we opted to go out of the hotel, so I can't comment on the food quality. The most disappointing part, though, was the distance from the hotel to the S/U-bahn stations. A brisk walker can make it to the Heidelberger Platz station in 10 minutes, but the stop isn't central to any of the major tourist areas. We wound up spending a lot of time trekking back and forth to the S/U station and then on trains to and from what we wanted to see which was tiring. If you stay here for 2 or 3 days, consider buying the Welcome Card for public transport from which we definitely got our money's worth. Berlin's public transportation system is excellent...we just wished it wasn't obligatory to use it for every little thing, but due to the hotel's location, it definitely was. On the positive, the hotel was clean, the staff friendly and accomodating. If I had to do it again, I'd probably spring for something more comfortable with an included breakfast. It was alright as a strictly budget hotel, but certainly nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gilly_06
Reviews.Content: The Winters hotel was an excellent choice for us as we were on a budget holiday. The hotel is in a very quiet area of Berlin although the city in general isn't overaly loud. We got exactly what we paid for so we can't complain. If your looking for a more fancy hotel then this isn't the place to come .The rooms were very basic but clean nonetheless. We had a shared bathroom but it was very well maintained at all times. There is running water in the room for those who are not getting a room with a bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful - providing us with information on how to get to all Berlin's major attractions. If your looking for a hotel in the centre of Berlin then this isn't exactly ideal but the metro system is both very cheap and easy to use. The metro stop for the hotel is heidelberger platz. Upon leaving the station cross the street and turn right and take the first left past the car park. It's about a 3 minute walk from here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Reckoning_nightuk
Reviews.Content: Well a few points, yes i agree with the point that for elderly people that U/S stations are a slight distance away, but if you are relatively fit, it should take no more than 5/10 minutes to reach the station you can walk through the lovely park to get to the U bahn station, the park also includes a play area for children and young at heart adults. We have stayed there twice now and found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a delight and the room more than adequate, clean and comfortable. Overall good value for money highly recommended...............People from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay for is what you get.”
Reviews.Author: G8YPE
Reviews.Content: Booked it through lastminute. My german is poor and I was greeted at the desk with polite efficient english, we arrived earlier that the normal booking in time and were pleased to hear our room was ready and we could book in early, no problem. We booked a 2* room, yes standard and not en-suite and we were very happy it was clean and bright and on a non-smoking floor which we had specified. 4 days later we left, very happy, great food and drink at the hotel and in the city centre. Yes the Hotel is a way for the city centre it's in a leafy quiet suburb, but there's no need to take a taxi.. Simply take the S or U-Bahn at the end of the road and discover Berlin. Tickets are purchased from a machine on the platform in english with an Underground train every couple of minutes and a S-Bahn train every 5 minutes or so. Berlin has a wonderfully integrated publiic transport system use it, become a Berliner during your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkGG
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: October 2006 (4 nights) Winter's Hotel Berlin is a cheap, clean, tidy and comfortable hotel. If you want luxury then this isn't for you, but if you a nice, basic hotel to return to at the end of the day then I can recommend this one. Rooms: This is a cheap hotel so the furniture may be from Ikea. Personally, I don't mind Ikea furniture if it is a good condition (which this certainly was.) It would appear (from these reviews) that rooms vary in size quite a bit, but we had a good size twin room (7m x 4m) at the far end of the hotel. Plenty of room to sit on the sofa and watch TV (including Sky News and CNN in English). Location: The hotel is 5 minute walk, down a quiet residential street, from the U-bahn and S-bahn stations at Heidelberger Platz. From here it takes about 20 minutes to get into the centre of town. Food: The breakfast buffet was an excellent way to get fuelled up, ready for a hard day's sightseeing. Bread, cheese and cold meats were available in the evening as well. The only place locally serving food was the "Doner station" so we ate in the city centre before we returned to the hotel. Hotel Bar: Pricey but not stupid. Are any hotel bars cheap? Staff: We found the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for money”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Winter's Hotel in August for six nghts with my husband and child. It's a budget hotel with very small rooms (about 12 square meters) furnished with Ikea's products. We stayed in two connected rooms with private shower and, considering the price we payed, I must say they are OK. I booked it through Needahotel and never payed less in a european capital. The breakfast is really good and the staff is, in general, friendly and helpful. Despite other members said before, the tube station is not far - about 600 meters or 5 minutes walk - and if you just walk 1 more minute you'll have a bus that leads you to the centre of the city(Zoologischer Garten). So, considering the price, it's a nice hotel, basic but clean, with everything that matters to those that want to know the city without spending too much money. Don't count with luxury of any kind. One more recomendation: the website shows you only the biggest rooms (on the reception building, I supose) the others are much smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: chicky_babenz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no where near town. To far away from everywhere. We booked this 7 months in advance with what we thought were no problems, when we arrived we were told that our booking had been cancelled. They did have a room available but not the type of room we requested. After speaking to the agents i booked this through they informed me that the reservation hadn't been cancelled. Staff didn't seem to care. Would NOT recommend to anyone. You could get better for the money, and alot closer to civilisation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Except for Cap'n Birdsye/Pugwash!”
Reviews.Author: Peeps-Bocadillo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and clean, excellent for the price. Location not the best but near S and U bahn station. Our room was also much smaller than our travelling companions and there was no mirror in the bedroom or a seating area. The bathroom had no extractor and no window so smells lingered - particularly if you had paid a visit to "Doner Station", near Heidelberger Platz, earlier. The chap on the reception desk at night was particulary rude - He looks like he might promote a range of fingers of cod in golden crumb. This hotel also has a 24 hour bar - be warned, its a bit pricey! Overall, above average, but because our room was on the top floor (which was the only one occupied)and very cold its deserves 3 points. The room was also slightly whiffy.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from centre...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Actually, this hotel is very nice. Nice and spacious room, nice bathroom, very clean and modern, good value, a free welcome drink in the bar, nice service. BUT... the location was a bit of a problem. It was simply too far away from everything. You had to walk 15 minutes just to reach the U-bahn! If you are a sight-seeing tourist in Berlin, that is simply too much. Also, the breakfast was not included in our room rate, wich is always a disappointment. Oh, I forgot to mention, a very nice thing was that the hotel offers free parking!

Reviews.Title: “standard room at ***rate hotel in 2005!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 500m from nearest subway located next to a highway is not suitable for not sportive elder people. standard room without douche + wc was UNDER PERFORMANCE. room was awfull with no cleaning at all the four nights we had spent. No possibility to change for other room WITH Douche + WC. Only the breakfast is perfect and worth ***rating. Location in suburb between flats is no enjoyable invitation. For this rate there enough **class hotels to be found in Berlin itself in a enjoyable neighbouhood. I will come back in Berlin but no more this hotel please.

Reviews.Title: “standard room awful/appartment fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel with Expedia for a standard room, on arriving it was standard alright. The room was like a prison room!!!!!! and stunk of smoke. Yes it was cheap but a little more comfort would have been nice. Don't be mislead by the pictures that you see of the rooms on the web, the standard rooms are nothing like the superior rooms. They are tiny, basic with little or no comfort apart from a roof over you head and a bed to sleep in. Ok for a few nights but no longer. We eventually managed to get a 1 bedroom appartment which was all they had left. We had to pay a lot extra, but it was worth it for the space. Instead of a drab and dreary room we had a bright and charming appartment with our own kitchen and bathroom. We were away from the Hotel but still part of it as we still had our appartment cleaned every day. We did not find the location a problem as the Berlin transport network is excellant, and we were olny 5 stops on the underground from the main centre. If we were to visit Berlin again we most certainly would book the appartment.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Winter was the cheapest hotel in a air-hotel package deal through Expedia. It's undergoing renovations on some floors to add en suite showers and toilets; mine was down the hall. But everything was spotless, the restaurant was good, and the staff very accomodating. They even have a wireless access point. HOWEVER: they are in a residential neighborhood about 6-8 blocks from the metro trains, and there are no restaurants etc available except the one at the hotel. If this doesn't bother you, you'll enjoy its quiet location. The Albatros is an old name, not currently used. -CD

HotelInfo.Name: Winters Hotel Berlin City Messe
HotelInfo.Address: Rudolfstadter Strasse 42 | Wilmersdorf, 10713 Berlin, Germany
